## Natural history notes

Buttonweed (Diodia virginiana) is a small plant native to the eastern and southeastern United States. It is typically found in shallow wetlands, usually closer to the waterâ€™s edge. It produces a tiny white flower that attracts butterflies and other pollinators. This is also a very nutritious forage food for gopher tortoises!
